intro: Anemone coronaria var. rissoana, commonly known as the Rissoan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and lobed leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often blooming in late spring to early summer. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
